result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $200.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 08/16/15 and on the 16th of each month thereafter until paid in full. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due forthwith and an immediate  entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Yvette Badgett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 
Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $200.00 plus all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8-16-2015 and on the 16th of each month thereafter until paid in full. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial on another matter.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett not in court, in custody, not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date at least 60 days out.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-28-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Bianca Luster in court, defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ULTA, 11500 W BURLEIGH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Kimberly Yvette Badgett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
